climbs.name: Pissed off Mofo

content.description: Crack start to pumpy finish.  This crack was named for some choice words that the mad Russian had to say during the bolting of the climb when he had a slight rope tangle.

climbs.name: Pali Gap
climbs.fa: 2007 Tony Horness, Tony Lusk, Andy Tretiakoff, Jimi

content.description: Shares chains with T&T and has a good pumpy finish
content.location: 12th route from the north and 3rd route south of the obvious overhanging roof by Matterhorness

climbs.name: Matterhorness
climbs.fa: 2007 Tony Horness, Tony Lusk, Andy Tretiakoff

content.description: Undercling above ledge to the crux with a overhung pumpy finish
content.location: 9th route from the north end that starts under the obvious roof

climbs.name: Manly Woman
climbs.fa: 2007 Kent Bruner, Tony Lusk, Tony Horness

content.description: Shares chains with Eman saves Tman.  The name says it all!!
content.location: This is the furthest route to the left on the Cave Wall.  It is on top of the Cave and above the Tall Wall

climbs.name: Lords of Karma
climbs.fa: 2007 Tony Horness, Tony Lusk, Andy Tretiakoff, Dave Weeks

content.description:
UPDATE 09/23/11* Warning: Bolt and/or hangers missing. Bolts and/or rock on the far right hand side of this wall may be of questionable integrity. Bolts reportedly pulled on Pali Gap and adjacent routes. Check back for further updates from the FA. 

  Bulgy warm up
content.location: Second route from the north side

climbs.name: Hornass Nest
climbs.fa: 2007 Tony Horness, Tony Lusk, Andy Tretiakoff

content.description: Vertical thin face to exposed pumpy finish.  TH got stung by a hornet the first day of developing the area
content.location: 8th route from the north end that starts just to the right of the obvious roof above the ledge

climbs.name: Eman saves Tman
climbs.fa: 2007 Tony Lusk, Tony Horness, Andy Tretiakoff

content.location: This route and Manly Woman are on the extreme south end of the Cave Wall.  They are both above the cave and on the top of the Tall Wall.

content.location: Third route from the north end

climbs.name: Bitter Table for One
climbs.fa: 2007 Tony Horness, Tony Lusk, Andy Tretiakoff

content.description: Climb left of the bulge, harder to do without using the tree at the ledge
content.location: 10th route from the north end starts left of the obvious roof at Matterhorness

content.description:
This area has 15 sport routes that are mostly moderates from 5.6 to 5.10. The wall has pumpier climbs ranging from 5.6 to 5.10 with morning sun and shade after 2pm.  Most of the climbs have a ledge half way up.  The area was found by Tony Lusk and Tony Horness on a day where Tony H's tips were too sore to climb.  Andy Tretiakoff helped develop the area as well.   

  The area has a cave on the south end of the Cave Wall that can provide shelter from sun and rain and has a sign in register with laminated route guide.  The view from the top of the crag encompasses the valley below Mt. Bigelow with Barnum Rock and Ridgeline due west while looking south to Rose Canyon and Munchkinland.
